header.ul:
For FTP access use ftp://ftp.exolab.org/pub/tyrex.
The Tyrex JAR
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$.jar
The Tyrex JARs, docs, DTDs, command line tools and examples
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$.tgz
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$.zip
Full documentation including all JavaDocs and specs (big)
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/ftp/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$-doc.tgz
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/ftp/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$-doc.zip
Full CVS snapshot: all sources, docs, libraries (big)
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/ftp/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$-src.tgz
ftp://ftp.exolab.org/ftp/pub/tyrex/tyrex-$VERSION$/tyrex-$VERSION$-src.zip

p.small: The tarball and zips includes all the JARs required by Tyrex, the docs and API JavaDocs. To fully install Tyrex, simply extract all the JARs into your classpath.
The CVS snapshot includes additional JARs required to build Tyrex. It is self sufficient and does not require any external components, except for javac.

The documentation set includes JavaDocs for the API and JavaDocs for the full source code, including class usage. A small documentation set without the full source JavaDocs is available in the tarball and zips.

All implementation JARs (i.e. non APIs) are available under an open source license and available from our FTP server. Open source licenses in use include Apache (ASF), Exolab, Mozilla (MPL), and public domain. All licenses are fully compatible with each other.
